title: ConocoPhillips shareholders reject executive pay proposal
text:
HOUSTON (Reuters) - Shareholders of oil producer ConocoPhillips ( COP.N ) rejected a proposal at their annual meeting on Tuesday that would have linked executive compensation with U.S. accounting standards.
FILE PHOTO: A Phillips66-owned Conoco gasoline station in St. Louis, Missouri January 14, 2015. REUTERS/Kate Munsch/File Photo Shareholders of the company, who met in a Houston hotel, also approved a slate of 10 for the board of directors and voted in favor of the existing executive compensation program.
Reporting by Ernest Scheyder; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
